medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute kidney injury (AKI) following COVID-19 infection.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced gross hematuria starting the day after COVID-19 diagnosis and was hospitalized on the third day of COVID-19 infection. Urine output decreased over the first three hospital days (880 mL, 400 mL, 600 mL), while serum creatinine increased to 13.97 mg/dL. She started hemodialysis on hospital day 4. Nausea and headache occurred during hemodialysis but improved over time, and her urine output and renal function began to recover after 5 hemodialysis sessions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with iron deficiency anemia several years ago; no other underlying diseases or recent exposure to nephrotoxic agents.
